column4: Using this: deb http://it.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu hoary main universe multiverse restricted   I get some errors.
The errors go away if I remove ``multiverse''.
Does it make any sense?
Let's try.
99% [6 Packages bzip2 0]  [Connecting to archive.ubuntu.com (82.211.81.151)]  [Wabzip2: (stdin) is not a bzip2 file.
Err http://archive.ubuntu.com hoary/main Packages
Sub-process bzip2 returned an error code (2)
sounds like you're behind a broken proxy
argh, damn.  This is indeed possible, I'm on a mobile connection.
is there a way to get the files from ftp or something?
sure
same address, just s/htp/ftp/
thank you very much, I'm trying.
for example?
when using emacs from ubuntu?
nope, but it's the same
it's the same?
It's the same if I use the emacs21 package.
that sounds like a x resources issue
during the last upgrade apt-get asked me about some file to keep or change, like "XTerm" or something I think.
I updated to the "mantainer's one"
any idea where I could search for it?
